editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.note: fols. 1, 2v, 3 blank. On fol. 3 is a long table of contents in an anglicana hand of c. 1300, with many additions of ss. xvi and xvii.

msItem.title: Epist. 137

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: De Antichristo
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber de antichristo
msItem.incipit: Descripcio cuiusdam sapientis breuiter de codicibus excerpta ad reginem Gerbergam Heinrici Saxorum nobilissimi regis filiam de antichristo in omnibus malificio atque in probitate digno. In primis proferendum est nobis quia dicitur antichristus. Ideo uidelicet quia in cunctis Christo contrarius erit et Christo contraria faciet

msItem.note: Here numbered in 54 chapters, corresponding to the printed text of the recensio altera (Bachiarius) in PL 58. 979–1054, chs 1–21, 52–4, 56–8, 63–5, 67, 69–84, 86–7, Augustine, De Dono Perseuerantiae, 2. 4. CPL 958a.

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Contra Mendacium
msItem.incipit: Incipit liber Aurelii Augustini Yponensis episcopi contra mendacium ad Consentinum. Multa mihi legenda misisti

msItem.title: Quaestiones Veteri et Novi Testamenti

msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt questiones Augustini de ueteri et noua lege

msItem.title: Sermones 346–8, 350

msItem.rubric: Incipit sermo beati Augustini de timore Dei
msItem.incipit: Recordamini nobiscum d. f. dixisse apostolum

msItem.rubric: Item de timore Dei
msItem.incipit: Multa nobis f. de timore Dei precepta sunt
Non dubito d. f. insitum esse cordibus uestris

msItem.rubric: Incipit sermo beati Augustini de laude caritatis
msItem.incipit: Diuinarum scripturarum multiplicem habundanciam
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit sermo sancti Augustini de laude caritatis

msItem.note: PL 39. 1522–9, 1553–5. fols. 388–9v blank but for a pen-trial on 389v.

supportDesc.extent:
389 leaves 325 200
240 135
The edges lightly retrimmed and stained yellow.
supportDesc.collation: A4(4 canc.), 1–3212, a bifolium; catchwords in ornamental frames; red leaf-lettering. fols. 2 and 3 were once in reverse order, as fol. 2v has offsets from the decoration on fol. 4, while fol. 3 has a clearer impression of the chain-staple and straps formerly on the front board than f. 2.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 51 lines. Prepared for running heads between lines ruled right across the page; filled in by hands of s. xvi, one writing humanistica.

handDesc.handNote: English gothic rotunda bookhands of medium quality.

decoDesc.decoNote: On fol. 4 an 11-line initial D in colours (pink, blue, orange) and gold, historiated in two registers: the Nativity above, Augustine preaching to a cleric below; three-sided bar border with vine-leaves, on the lower limb a hound chasing a ?rabbit (excised). Red and blue flourished initials; red initials flourished with violet, blue initials flourished in red; red or blue paraphs.

binding.p: Modern, style of MS 36, but with new boards; sewn on six bands. An earlier binding had two straps or clasps, and an iron chain-staple in the middle of the foot of the front board.

history.provenance: Coxe, p. 27, records a note on the verso of the former end flyleaf, now lost: ‘Caucio M. Ricardi Elyngdon exposita domui scolarium de Merton in Oxonia pro xx. s. in festo S. Fredeswyde anno Domini millesimo CCCº quinquagesimo’. Elindon (BRUO 634) occ. as fellow in 1334–5, 1353, rector of Lapworth, d. by Dec. 1367.
On fol. 1v ‘Varii Tractatus Augustini quaere Titulos fol. 2 p:2’ and ‘N. 3. 11. Art:’, s. xvii, the second canc. and replaced with ‘B. 3. 1 (XXXVII)’, in red.
On fol. 2 ‘M. A. 3. 6’ (canc.) and ‘Liber Collegii Mertonensis Oxon:’, s. xvii. On fol. 3v is the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, pp. 25–7; Powicke, no. 341; Römer 2. 304–5; Alexander & Temple, no. 298 and pl. XXI.
